intro: Ruehssia ulei, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow, pendulous flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. The leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets.
